metadata.title: CVE-2013-4934 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
The netmon_open function in wiretap/netmon.c in the Netmon file parser inWireshark 1.8.x before 1.8.9 and 1.10.x before 1.10.1 does not initializecertain structure members, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (application crash) via a crafted packet-trace file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark5 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap4 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil4 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
